title: When It Comes to Climate Change, There’s No Such Thing as a New Normal
description: The phrase belies the fact that the climate is set to only get weirder from here on out.

description: Being a Barbie-loving feminist might seem contradictory, but the truth is far more complicated

title: Exclusive: Ukraine’s Foreign Minister Says ‘We Don’t Need Russia’ To Resume Grain Shipments
description: Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tells TIME Kyiv is "ready to test" Moscow's threats to grain shipments

title: Stanford’s President Announces Resignation Over Concerns About His Research
description: Marc Tessier-Lavigne resigns citing an independent review clearing him of research misconduct but found flaws in some of his papers.

title: What Women’s Soccer Means to Queer Fans
description: Women’s soccer has long been a more empowering space for LGBTQ+ individuals.

title: How to Keep Your Home Cool in Extreme Heat
description: There are several ways to keep your home cool during a heat wave, even if you don't have air conditioning.

title: Oppenheimer Dazzles With Its Epic Story of a Complicated Patriot
description: Either despite its intense craft or because of it, Christopher Nolan's 3-hour movie about the architect of the atomic bomb works.

title: The Radical Joy of Breastfeeding My 3-Year-Old
description: It eases my anxiety. It is sentimental, sensory, and sensual. It fills me with love.

title: What We Don’t Know About the Health Effects of Wildfire Smoke
description: We don't know enough yet about wildfire smoke

title: This May Be Why Some People Don’t Get COVID-19 Symptoms
description: A new study says a gene mutation may explain why some people don't get COVID-19 symptoms when they're infected by SARS-CoV-2.

title: Soccer-Loving Vietnam Looks to Women’s Team to Make History
description: In its first-ever World Cup appearance, Vietnam will face off against the U.S.

title: Honduras Wants to Build the West’s Only Island Prison Colony—and Lock 2,000 Gangsters Inside
description: President Xiomara Castro plans to build an isolated prison for 2,000 gang leaders on the Islas del Cisne archipelago.

title: The American Public’s Views on Israel Are Undergoing a Profound Shift. Washington Hasn’t Caught Up
description: President Herzog's D.C. trip has only underscored the growing public divide over U.S. policy toward the Middle East.

title: A Rift Among Democrats Over Israel Ends With a Whimper
description: A bid by House Republicans to force Democrats to vote against a pro-Israel measure fell flat, as it easily passed with little debate.

title: Harmful Content Has Surged on Twitter, Keeping Advertisers Away
description: Under owner Elon Musk, Twitter has seen a dramatic spike in hateful, violent and inaccurate posts, according to researchers.

title: Inside the Controversy Over Amsterdam’s Plan to Move Sex Workers to a Suburban ‘Erotic Center’
description: TIME reports on the radical proposal to reshape the Red Light District and ferry sex workers to the suburbs.

title: What We Know About the American Soldier Who Fled to North Korea
description: Pyongyang often uses detained Americans—the last case was about five years ago—as political pawns and seeks maximum concessions for their release.
